Reset Akamai PowerShell options.
Removes the Akamai PowerShell options JSON file located at either `~/.akamai-pwsh/options.json` or the location found in the `AkamaiOptionsPath` environment variable.
EdgeGrid credential validation.
The `Confirm-Auth` cmdlet verifies the format of EdgeGrid authentication credentials against regular expressions.
An authentication object containing your credentials.
To get the object, run the `Get-AkamaiCredentials` cmdlet and save the output to a variable. Use the variable as the value.
An authentication object containing your credentials.
To get the object, run the `Get-AkamaiCredentials` cmdlet and save the output to a variable. Use the variable as the value.

dev:remarks.maml:para: There is no response if all credentials match standard format.

maml:description.maml:para: Decode Base64.
Converts a Base64-encoded string to plain text.
A Base64-encoded string to decode.
A Base64-encoded string to decode.
Encode in Base64.
Converts a plain-text string to Base64 encoding.
A plain-text string to encode.
A plain-text string to encode.
Decorate Akamai errors.
Convertes JSON-formatted error data to PowerShell objects and updates the format of error records for easier troubleshooting.
An error record object to update.
Akamai options specified in a `PSCustomObject`.
An error record object to update.
Akamai options specified in a `PSCustomObject`.
Formats a filename for consistency.
The `Format-Filename` cmdlet encodes invalid characters in `file/directory` names.
The name of the file to format.
The name of the file to format.

dev:type.maml:name: A `PSCustomObject` converted from a JSON formatted API response.

maml:description.maml:para: Format query string.
Performs various operations to sanitize a query string, mostly to url-encode spaces, and removes null query parameters from the string before signature calculation.
A query string to format.
A query string to format.
Calculate an EdgeGrid authorization header.
Calculates a valid EdgeGrid authorization header using the provided request details and API client credentials.
Akamai credentials specified in a `PSCustomObject`.
The request method.
The request path.
The request body to include in the auth calculation.
An input file to be read as part of the auth calculation.
The maximum size of the body parameter. Defaults to `128KB`.
The request body to include in the auth calculation.
Akamai credentials specified in a `PSCustomObject`.
The request path.
An input file to be read as part of the auth calculation.
The maximum size of the body parameter. Defaults to `128KB`.
The request method.
Gets EdgeGrid credentials.
The `Get-AkamaiCredentials` cmdlet gets EdgeGrid credentials from session or environment variables or an authentication file.
The path to an edgerc file. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The edgerc section name. Defaults to `default`.
A key used to apply changes to an account external to your credentials' account.
The path to an edgerc file. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The edgerc section name. Defaults to `default`.
A key used to apply changes to an account external to your credentials' account.
Get Akamai Options.
Returns a global `AkamaiOptions` variable. If the variable doesn't exist, the function creates it.
The `Get-AkamaiSession` cmdlet gets the current Akamai session information. Used with `Set-AkamaiSession` to switch session information.
Returns an `AkamaiSession` variable.
Create a User-Agent for requests.
Collates the necessary details from the module version and OS to create a unique User-Agent string sent along with all requests. Used to track version and platform usage in API logs.
Get API client authorization grants.
Returns information about the Akamai API client, including the APIs that the client is authorized to access.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.
Output API response body as a PSCustomObject.
An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Output API response body as a PSCustomObject.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Convert a `-Body` parameter to a `PSCustomObject`.
Use this function for various endpoints that require body manipulation. It takes a `-Body` parameter as either a hashtable or string and converts it to a `PSCustomObject`.
The request body, either as a `PSCustomObject`, hashtable, or string.
The request body, either as a `PSCustomObject`, hashtable, or string.

Takes a message string and secret and returns HMACSHA256-hashed ciphertext. Used in EdgeGrid authorization header calculation.
The secret key for encryption.
The message to encrypt.
The message to encrypt.
The secret key for encryption.

Auththentication `file/env` variable section.
Generate a random string.
Produces a random string of a given length in one of these formats: alphabetical, alphanumeric, numerical, or hexadecimal.
When the switch parameter is present, this produces alphanumeric output.
The number of characters you want your random string to contain.
When the switch parameter is present, this produces alphabetical output.
The number of characters you want your random string to contain.

NetStorage authorization wrapper.
The `Invoke-AkamaiNSAPIRequest` cmdlet provides an authorization wrapper around `Invoke-RestMethod` for use with the NetStorage API.
The API endpoint's request path.
The API endpoint's action type.
A hashtable of additional options for a request.
The data sent to the endpoint. Value is a hashtable that includes values for each parameter.
> Important: Because `Body` is a free field, our PowerShell module doesn't validate the data you include, the API does.
If needed by an endpoint, an input file's location.
If provided by an endpoint, where to place an output file.
The path to an authentication file.
The authentication file's section name.
The API endpoint's request path.
The API endpoint's action type.
A hashtable of additional options for a request.
The data sent to the endpoint. Value is a hashtable that includes values for each parameter.
> Important: Because `Body` is a free field, our PowerShell module doesn't validate the data you include, the API does.
If needed by an endpoint, an input file's location.
If provided by an endpoint, where to place an output file.
The path to an authentication file.
The authentication file's section name.
Sends a HTTPS request to an Akamai RESTful web service.

The `Invoke-Akamai RestMethod` cmdlet sends a HTTPS request to Akamai RESTful web services and formats the response based on data type. When the REST endpoint returns multiple objects, the objects are received as an array. If you pipe the output from `Invoke-AkamaiRequest` to another command, it's sent as a single `[Object[]]` object. The contents of that array are not enumerated for the next command on the pipeline.
A resource's path minus the host.
The path to an edgerc file. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The edgerc section name. Defaults to `default`.
A key used to apply changes to an account external to your credentials' account.
Specifies the method used for the web request. Values are `GET`, `HEAD`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE` and `PATCH`.
A hashtable of request query parameters to add to request. If the same key is found in `Path` and `QueryParameters`, the `QueryParameters` value persists.
A hashtable of any additional request headers.

The data sent to the endpoint. Value is a hashtable that includes values for each parameter. > Important: Because `Body` is a free field, our PowerShell module doesn't validate the data you include, the API does.
If needed by an endpoint, an input file's location.
If provided by an endpoint, where to place an output file.
The maximum message body size. Default is `2048` bytes. Increase as needed up to `131072` bytes.
Retry index. Used when handling error retries
Switch to be passed through to Invoke-WebRequest in order to avoid status codes 300+ throwing an error. Note: only compatible with Pwsh7+
A resource's path minus the host.
Specifies the method used for the web request. Values are `GET`, `HEAD`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE` and `PATCH`.
A hashtable of request query parameters to add to request. If the same key is found in `Path` and `QueryParameters`, the `QueryParameters` value persists.
A hashtable of any additional request headers.

The data sent to the endpoint. Value is a hashtable that includes values for each parameter. > Important: Because `Body` is a free field, our PowerShell module doesn't validate the data you include, the API does.
If needed by an endpoint, an input file's location.
If provided by an endpoint, where to place an output file.
The maximum message body size. Default is `2048` bytes. Increase as needed up to `131072` bytes.
Switch to be passed through to Invoke-WebRequest in order to avoid status codes 300+ throwing an error. Note: only compatible with Pwsh7+
Retry index. Used when handling error retries
The path to an edgerc file. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The edgerc section name. Defaults to `default`.
A key used to apply changes to an account external to your credentials' account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-AkamaiRequest -Method "POST" -Path "/path/to/api" -InputFile "~./path/to/body.json" Request: `POST` without query parameters and path to the JSON body containing the body of the call. Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-AkamaiRequest -Method "PATCH" -Path "/path/to/api?withParams=true" -Body '{"key":{"key3": "value"}}' Request: `PATCH` with query parameters for an existing item and an inline body. Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-AkamaiRequest -Method "DELETE" -Path "/path/to/api?itemId" Request: `DELETE` with an ID for the item to delete as a query parameter. Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.

maml:description.maml:para: Sends a HTTPS request to an Akamai RESTful web service.
The `Invoke-Akamai RestMethod` cmdlet sends a HTTPS request to Akamai RESTful web services and formats the response based on data type.

When the REST endpoint returns multiple objects, the objects are received as an array. If you pipe the output from `Invoke-AkamaiRestMethod` to another command, it's sent as a single `[Object[]]` object. The contents of that array are not enumerated for the next command on the pipeline.
Specifies the method used for the web request. Values are `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE` and `PATCH`.
The edgerc section name. Defaults to `default`.
A key used to apply changes to an account external to your credentials' account.
A resource's path minus the host.
A hashtable of request query parameters to add to request. If the same key is found in `Path` and `QueryParameters`, the `QueryParameters` value persists.
A hashtable of any additional request headers.
The data sent to the endpoint. Value is a hashtable that includes values for each parameter.
> Important: Because `Body` is a free field, our PowerShell module doesn't validate the data you include, the API does.
If needed by an endpoint, an input file's location.
If provided by an endpoint, where to place an output file.
The maximum message body size. Default is `2048` bytes. Increase as needed up to `131072` bytes.
The path to an edgerc file. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Flag to include headers in the function response
Specifies the method used for the web request. Values are `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE` and `PATCH`.
A resource's path minus the host.
A hashtable of request query parameters to add to request. If the same key is found in `Path` and `QueryParameters`, the `QueryParameters` value persists.
A hashtable of any additional request headers.
The data sent to the endpoint. Value is a hashtable that includes values for each parameter.
> Important: Because `Body` is a free field, our PowerShell module doesn't validate the data you include, the API does.
If needed by an endpoint, an input file's location.
If provided by an endpoint, where to place an output file.
The maximum message body size. Default is `2048` bytes. Increase as needed up to `131072` bytes.
Flag to include headers in the function response
The path to an edgerc file. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The edgerc section name. Defaults to `default`.
A key used to apply changes to an account external to your credentials' account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Request: `POST` without query parameters and an inline body.
Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.
Request: `POST` without query parameters and path to the JSON body containing the body of the call.
Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.
Request: `PUT` with query parameters for an existing item and an inline body.
Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.
Request: `PATCH` with query parameters for an existing item and an inline body.
Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.
Request: `DELETE` with an ID for the item to delete as a query parameter.
Response: The data returned is dependent upon the endpoint and varies.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a default data cache object.
Creates a `PSCustomObject` of a given format and assigns it to a globally-scoped variable. This variable holds the in-memory data cache if this feature is enabled.
Populate Akamai options.

Creates a new `PSCustomObject` of the supported options and writes that object to a disk, either at the default location of `~/.akamai-pwsh/options.json` or to a location specified in the `AkamaiOptionsPath` environment variable.
Creates a new Akamai Session info variable in the Script scope
The `New-AkamaiSession` cmdlet creates a new Akamai Session variable. Used by the `Invoke-AkamaiRestMethod` cmdlet's authentication scheme.
An API client's client secret.
The API credential's hostname.
The API credential's client access token.
An API client's client token.
Account switch key, for use when an API client has access to multiple accounts.
Alias = Section. The environment for which the authorization information is used. Default is `default`.
Returns the session variable instead of setting the script scope session variable.
The path to a JSON file that contains API credentials. Multiple credential sections allowed. If used, individual authorization parameters are ignored.
Returns the session variable instead of setting the script scope session variable.

Returns the session variable instead of setting the script scope session variable.
Create an Edge auth token.

Various Akamai services make use of Token Authentication or similar services, which require encrypted tokens. This function will create such a token from the given inputs for you to use in testing or live requests.
An `acl` element to include in the edge auth token.
An algorithm to use in calculating the edge auth token signature. Defaults to `sha256` but also accepts `sha1` and `md5`.
The `data` element to include in the edge auth token.
the field delimiter. Defaults to `~`.
The token duration in hours. During token generation, it's converted to seconds.
The token duration in minutes. During token generation, it's converted to seconds.
The token duration in seconds.
The token end time in epoch format.
When the switch parameter is present, it forces a URL token element to be URL-encoded.
The `id` element to include in the edge auth token.
The `ip` element to include in the edge auth token.
The `salt` element to include in the edge auth token.
The secret key for encryption.
The token start time in epoch format.

The `Remove-AkamaiSession` cmdlet deletes session variable.
Add to or update the Data Cache.

Creates or updates elements in the in-memory Akamai data cache, such as properties, AppSec configurations, and more, and is called by various sub-module functions automatically when elements included in the cache scope are retrieved from the Akamai APIs.

Update Akamai Options.

Updates any of the supported Akamai options, either as booleans to enable or disable certain features, for example, `-EnableErrorRetried $true`, or as integers to set various thresholds and limits, for example, `-MaxErrorRetries 2`. You can also reset all options to their defaults with `-RestoreDefaults`.
> Note: You can't set any options and restore the others to default in a single command. You need to restore the defaults first, then set whatever options you wish.
Forces the addition of a header disabling prefixes in all Property API calls, regardless of API client setting.
Enables the in-memory data cache feature, which caches resolution of names to IDs and speeds up subsequent API calls.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 5XX status code.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 429 status code.

Enables outputting a warning when you have reached a set percentage of your rate limit, e.g. if the limit is 500 requests, your warning percentage is 80 and you have expended 400 requests, any further requests before the rate limit repleneshes will result in a warning being printed to the shell.

Enables the recommended actions provider, which will suggest actions in the event of certain errors. This feature requires the use of the `PSFeedbackProvider` Powershell experimental feature, and currently has an extremely limited scope.
Set the initial wait time (in seconds) after which PowerShell will retry an applicable request.
Set the maximum number of retries which will be attempted for applicable requests in the event of an error.
Set the percentage used of the rate limit for a given endpoint, above which PowerShell will warn you of rate limit exhaustion.
Restore Akamai options to the default values.
Forces the addition of a header disabling prefixes in all Property API calls, regardless of API client setting.
Enables the in-memory data cache feature, which caches resolution of names to IDs and speeds up subsequent API calls.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 5XX status code.
Enables retries for applicable requests when the API endpoint responds with a 429 status code.

Enables outputting a warning when you have reached a set percentage of your rate limit, e.g. if the limit is 500 requests, your warning percentage is 80 and you have expended 400 requests, any further requests before the rate limit repleneshes will result in a warning being printed to the shell.

Enables the recommended actions provider, which will suggest actions in the event of certain errors. This feature requires the use of the `PSFeedbackProvider` Powershell experimental feature, and currently has an extremely limited scope.
Set the initial wait time (in seconds) after which PowerShell will retry an applicable request.
Set the maximum number of retries which will be attempted for applicable requests in the event of an error.
Set the percentage used of the rate limit for a given endpoint, above which PowerShell will warn you of rate limit exhaustion.
Restore Akamai options to the default values.
Switches Akamai session information.
The `Set-AkamaiSession` cmdlet switches the Akamai session information passed in session. Use with `New-AkamaiSession` to initially create a session hashtable.
A session variable created with `New-AkamaiSession`. Use `Get-AkamaiSession` to fetch the session information in the correct format.
A session variable created with `New-AkamaiSession`. Use `Get-AkamaiSession` to fetch the session information in the correct format.
Validate string is in ISO 8601 format.
Checks if the datetime string is in ISO 8601 format.
The timestamp to verify if it's in ISO 8601 format.
When the switch parameter is present, the function's input contains both date and time elements.
The timestamp to verify if it's in ISO 8601 format.
When the switch parameter is present, the function's input contains both date and time elements.
Test an Akamai endpoint.
This function is a simple wrapper to `Invoke-AkamaiRestMethod` with fewer options. It provides a more simplified way of testing API endpoints.
Your request path.
The request method.
The request body to include in the auth calculation.
The `Accept` request header value.
The `Content-Type` request header value.

An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.

Remove one or more versions of Akamai PowerShell modules.

Uninstalls one or more versions of the Akamai PowerShell module(s). Use it primarily to clean up version 1.x installations that aren't automatically upgraded when installing version 2. You can use this function to remove a specific version, uninstall all versions, remove all installed instances of version 1, or delete all versions except for the latest version of both v1 and v2 simultaneously.
Remove all versions of Akamai PowerShell from all applicable locations.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Remove all but the latest installed version of Akamai PowerShell. This will also include the V1 AkamaiPowershell module.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Remove all versions of the monolithic Akamai Powershell (v1) module. Any installed modules of version 2.0 or above will not be affected.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.

Remove any installed Akamai modules matching a given version string. Note: if you only specify the major and minor versions, e.g. 2.0, all patch version numbers will also be removed, e.g. 2.0.1, 2.0.2 etc. The same applies if you only supply a major version, any matching minor or patch versions will be removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Remove all versions of Akamai PowerShell from all applicable locations.
Remove all but the latest installed version of Akamai PowerShell. This will also include the V1 AkamaiPowershell module.
Remove all versions of the monolithic Akamai Powershell (v1) module. Any installed modules of version 2.0 or above will not be affected.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
By default, this funtion will inspect all folders in your PSModulePath environmen variable. Add this option if you would like to apply the removals to a specific directory.

Remove any installed Akamai modules matching a given version string. Note: if you only specify the major and minor versions, e.g. 2.0, all patch version numbers will also be removed, e.g. 2.0.1, 2.0.2 etc. The same applies if you only supply a major version, any matching minor or patch versions will be removed.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
